page.title: 20Summary of the area
page.content: The town of Castle Cary has a population of approximately 2,700.This includes the associated village of Ansford,to the north of Castle Cary,which has its own parish church. Children from the surrounding area,including the villages/hamlets of Alford,Clanville and Sutton come within the catchment area of Castle Cary schools,while those in Alhampton attend Ditcheat Primary but join the others at Ansford Secondary. The main feature of the surrounding area is dairy farming,with some light industry based in Castle Cary and Ansford.The majority of the population is centred in Castle Cary and Ansford,while a proportion of village properties are now being sold as holiday homes/weekend cottages.
